title: How to do simple shading
steps: First, find where you could imagine where less kight is
find the darkest corner, and start sketching diagonal lines from there

title: How to do hatching technique
steps: First, find where where less light would be
find the darkest point, shading lines from there
draw your lines parralel to the direction you shade
as you get further away, use less pressure

title: How to cross-hatching
steps: First, find where you could imagine where less light is
find the darkest point, shading lines from there
draw your lines parralel to the direction you shade
as you get further away, use less pressure
this time, once you finish, draw another set of lines
these lines should blend in with the first

title: How to draw outlines perfectly
steps: To draw outlines perfectly, you need to be steady and deliberate
first of all, make a light sketch of your planned outline
PS: pencil must be sharpened!
now carefully, draw small, deliberate lines

title: How to draw 1 point perspective
steps: sketch a horizontal line. This will represent eye level
sketch a point on the line, as vanishing point in your 3D scene
sketch a diagonal line the across vanishing point in the horizontal line
draw another diagonal line, flipped, so that it makes an X on the point
Use this diagram as guidance for 3D scenes.
the closer objects are to vanishing point, the further they are

title: How to draw highlights
steps: To draw highlights, you need to shade your drawing first
find the area where your light point(s) come from
idenfify the direction your light is in
PS: if youd like, you can draw a icon with a directional arrow
now, imagine your drawing as a 3D object with perspective
(this part is hard)
combine the distance and direction, erasing the strongest light points
the shinier an object is, the more highlighting it needs
